data.title: CrossFit MINS Workout
data.text: Workout of the Day 26.10.2025 WODDAILYSWEAT For Quality 6 Rounds 3:00 Row/Ski Erg 20 Box Stepups 15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16) 10 Ring Rows Sweat: 16/8 Train: 20/12 Compete: 24/16"
data.full_text:
Workout of the Day

26.10.2025

WOD
DAILYSWEAT


For Quality
6 Rounds
3:00 Row/Ski Erg
20 Box Stepups
15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16)
10 Ring Rows


Sweat: 16/8
Train: 20/12
Compete: 24/16"

ai_explanation.explanation:
Workout Overview


Hey everyone! Todayâ€™s WOD is all about quality movement and building endurance. Weâ€™ll be going through 6 rounds of a mix of rowing or skiing, box step-ups, kettlebell sumo deadlift high pulls, and ring rows. The goal here is to maintain good form throughout each movement while focusing on your breathing and pacing. Remember, itâ€™s not just about getting through the rounds; itâ€™s about doing each rep with intention and control.


Workout Components


1. Row/Ski Erg (3:00)

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • For the rower: Sit with your feet strapped in, grab the handle, and start with your knees bent and back straight.
  • Push through your legs to initiate the pull, lean back slightly, and pull the handle to your chest, keeping your elbows close.
  • Reverse the motion: extend your arms, lean forward, and bend your knees to return to the starting position.
  • For the Ski Erg: Stand tall, grip the handles, and initiate the movement by pulling down with your arms while engaging your core and legs.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your back straight and avoid rounding your shoulders.
  • Use your legs to drive the movement; your arms should follow.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • If youâ€™re new to rowing, consider reducing the time to 2:00 or using a lower resistance setting.
  • For the Ski Erg, you can also reduce the time or focus on a steady pace rather than max effort.

    • 2. Box Step-Ups (20 reps)

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • Stand facing the box with your feet hip-width apart.
  • Step up onto the box with one foot, pressing through your heel to lift your body up.
  • Bring your other foot up to meet the first on top of the box, then step back down one foot at a time.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your chest up and engage your core throughout the movement.
  • Make sure your entire foot is on the box before stepping down.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • Use a lower box if youâ€™re not comfortable with the height.
  • You can also perform step-ups without weights or use a dumbbell for added resistance.

    • 3. Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (15 reps)

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes slightly pointed out, and the kettlebell on the ground between your feet.
  • Hinge at your hips and bend your knees to grab the kettlebell with both hands.
  • Drive through your heels to stand up, pulling the kettlebell up along your body to your chin, leading with your elbows.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your back straight and chest up as you lift.
  • Ensure your elbows are higher than your wrists at the top of the movement.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • Use a lighter kettlebell if youâ€™re new to this movement.
  • You can also perform a kettlebell deadlift (without the high pull) to focus on form.

    • 4. Ring Rows (10 reps)

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • Set the rings at a height that allows you to lean back with your arms extended.
  • Grab the rings with an overhand grip and lean back, keeping your body straight.
  • Pull your chest towards the rings, squeezing your shoulder blades together at the top.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
  • Avoid using momentum; focus on controlled movements.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • Adjust the height of the rings to make the movement easier or harder.
  • If rings are too challenging, you can substitute with TRX rows or bent-over dumbbell rows.

    • Loading and Rep-Modification Options


  • **Sweat:**
  • Use a lighter kettlebell (16/8 kg) and aim for a steady pace on the row/Ski Erg. Focus on form and breathing.

  • **Train:**
  • Use a moderate kettlebell (20/12 kg) and challenge yourself with the full time on the row/Ski Erg. Maintain a consistent rhythm.

  • **Compete:**
  • Use a heavier kettlebell (24/16 kg) and push your limits on the row/Ski Erg. Aim for a strong finish on each round.

    • Strategy Advice

  • **Pacing:** Start each round with a steady pace on the row/Ski Erg. Itâ€™s easy to go too hard at the beginning, but remember, you have 6 rounds to complete!
  • **Breaks:** Donâ€™t hesitate to take short breaks between movements if you need to. Itâ€™s better to maintain quality than to rush through.
  • **Focus on Quality:** Each rep should be performed with good form. If you feel your technique slipping, consider scaling down or taking a breather.

    • Alright, team! Letâ€™s get after it, focus on our movements, and have some fun! Remember, quality over quantity today. Letâ€™s go! ðŸ’ª

combined_content.title: CrossFit MINS Workout
combined_content.workout_text:
WOD:

For Quality

6 Rounds:

  • 3:00 Row/Ski Erg
  • 20 Box Step-ups
  • 15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16)
  • 10 Ring Rows

    • Sweat: 16/8

    Train: 20/12

    Compete: 24/16
